org.zelvator.file

Class ModifyXMLFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.zelvator.file.ModifyXMLFile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TesterTagsAndAttributes

    public class ModifyXMLFile
extends java.lang.Object
implements TesterTagsAndAttributes
    This class is for editing xml nodes, creating new xml file and saving to the xml file.
     

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.zelvator.file.TesterTagsAndAttributes

        CESTA, ID, OTAZKA, QUESTION, QUESTIONS, SPATNA, SPRAVNA

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ModifyXMLFile(java.lang.String path)
      Constructor will load xml file from given path into memory, which can be modified and then eventually saved to the file again.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void appendNodetoQuestion(org.w3c.dom.Node question, java.lang.String newElement, java.lang.String elementValue, java.lang.String pathToPic)
      This method will append new Node to Question node, for instance question will have correct answer in the tag "spravna" (correct), all nodes have must have some value and attribute named "cesta" (path to image), attribute can be empty, tester will handle this exception by empty image.
      static void createNewXML(java.lang.String path)
      Method will try to create new XML file in the specified path, which should be created before by taking name of the test, which user sets in the dialog for test editation.
      void createQuestionNode(int id)
      This method will create new question node with given ID.
      void fillQuestionsList()
      Method will go through the NodeList, where are loaded question nodes and for each one by one will be set attributes for the Question object from element in the node list.
      int findLastId()
      Method will search for last used id and add one for purpose to creating new question id.

      org.w3c.dom.Document getDocument(java.lang.String path)
      Method loads xml file into memory and create Document instance, which can be modified.

      Method will normalize given Document and then loads all question nodes into NodeList.

      This method will search for question with given index (id).
      java.util.List<Question> getQuestions()

      Method used for changing attribute in the node.

      This method will remove all occurrences of child node in the question node.
      static void saveToXML(org.w3c.dom.Document doc, java.lang.String filepath)
      This method is supposed to save all changes in the nodes to the XML file.
      void setDoc(org.w3c.dom.Document doc) 
      void setnList(org.w3c.dom.NodeList nList) 
      void setPath(java.lang.String path) 
      void setQuestions(java.util.List<Question> questions) 
      void updateQuestionNode(org.w3c.dom.Node question, java.lang.String otazka, java.lang.String pathToPic, java.util.List<Answer> answers)
      Method will remove all existing elements in the question node, (in case of multiple answers, there is problem with recognizing which is which... there could be IDs for those elements, as they are in the question node, and you could find them and manage them, but this seemed easier in the time of writing code, so it is like this) and then append all nodes again from Question object, here are sent attributes from object right away.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • findLastId

        public int findLastId()
        Method will search for last used id and add one for purpose to creating new question id.
        In some cases there could be problem, because it will get last element no matter what. By using editor, it should be all fine, if you swap elements manually in the xml file, you could create duplicates by this method, because it will not know about that and there could be errors with loading test.
        Returns:
        new usable ID for question node

      • createQuestionNode

        public void createQuestionNode(int id)
        This method will create new question node with given ID.
        Parameters:
        id -

      • appendNodetoQuestion

        public void appendNodetoQuestion(org.w3c.dom.Node question,
                        java.lang.String newElement,
                        java.lang.String elementValue,
                        java.lang.String pathToPic)
        This method will append new Node to Question node, for instance question will have correct answer in the tag "spravna" (correct), all nodes have must have some value and attribute named "cesta" (path to image), attribute can be empty, tester will handle this exception by empty image.
        Parameters:
        question -
        newElement -
        elementValue -
        pathToPic -

      • updateQuestionNode

        public void updateQuestionNode(org.w3c.dom.Node question,
                      java.lang.String otazka,
                      java.lang.String pathToPic,
                      java.util.List<Answer> answers)
        Method will remove all existing elements in the question node, (in case of multiple answers, there is problem with recognizing which is which... there could be IDs for those elements, as they are in the question node, and you could find them and manage them, but this seemed easier in the time of writing code, so it is like this) and then append all nodes again from Question object, here are sent attributes from object right away.
        Parameters:
        question -
        otazka -
        pathToPic -
        answers -

      • removeNodeInQuestionNode

        public void removeNodeInQuestionNode(org.w3c.dom.Node question,
                            java.lang.String nameOfNode)
        This method will remove all occurrences of child node in the question node. That's why it is in the loop.
        Parameters:
        question -
        nameOfNode -

      • fillQuestionsList

        public void fillQuestionsList()
        Method will go through the NodeList, where are loaded question nodes and for each one by one will be set attributes for the Question object from element in the node list. After loading all values and attributes, question will be added to the Question ArrayList.

      • saveToXML

        public static void saveToXML(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
             java.lang.String filepath)
                      throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
        This method is supposed to save all changes in the nodes to the XML file. Method takes Document and file path, format it and serializes (saves) as XML file.
        Parameters:
        doc -
        filepath -
        Throws:
        javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

      • createNewXML

        public static void createNewXML(java.lang.String path)
        Method will try to create new XML file in the specified path, which should be created before by taking name of the test, which user sets in the dialog for test editation. Before saving it will create new Document, create root element and append it as a node and after that it will save it to the folder.
        Parameters:
        path -
